properties.headline: NSW Health Vaccination Centre - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK Figtree Drive at Australia Avenue
properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip by public transport at transportnsw.info.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Sydney Olympic Park NSW Health Vaccination Centres – transport and parking map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Sydney Olympic Park NSW Health Vaccination Centres – transport and parking map

properties.otherAdvice:
The NSW Health Vaccination Centre in Sydney Olympic Park is located at 1 Figtree Drive. The centre is in operation for those with confirmed appointments only from 8am to 7pm, Monday to Saturday. 

Free parking is available at P3 car park on Sarah Durack Ave for those with vaccination appointments. Follow the signs to navigate the short walk to the centre, alternatively a shuttle bus will run to the centre approximately every 20 minutes.

Allow additional travel time on roads approaching the precinct including Australia Ave, Underwood Rd and Hill Rd, and follow the directions of traffic control and staff on site.

For more information about the COVID-19 Vaccination Program in NSW or to check your eligibility and make a booking, visit the NSW Health website at health.nsw.gov.au/COVID-19.

properties.headline: NSW Health Vaccination Centre - BELMONT Pacific Highway near Floraville Road, Floraville
properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip by public transport at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
The NSW Health Vaccination Centre in Belmont is located at the former Bunnings site at 393 Pacific Hwy. The centre is in operation for those with confirmed appointments only from 8am to 6:45pm daily Monday to Friday, and from 8am to 2:45pm on Saturday and Sunday. 

Allow additional travel time on roads approaching the precinct particularly during the morning and evening peak. 

For more information about the COVID-19 Vaccination Program in NSW or to check your eligibility and make a booking, visit the NSW Health website at health.nsw.gov.au/COVID-19.

properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip by public transport at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
The NSW Health Vaccination Centre in the Sydney CBD is located at 175 Pitt St and is in operation for those with confirmed appointments only from 8am to 8pm on Monday to Friday, and from 8am to 4pm on Saturday and Sunday. 

Allow additional travel time on roads approaching the precinct particularly during the morning and evening peak. 

For more information about the COVID-19 Vaccination Program in NSW or to check your eligibility and make a booking, visit the NSW Health website at health.nsw.gov.au/COVID-19.

properties.headline: Boxing Day sales - Sunday 26 December - SYDNEY CBD Market Street, Castlereagh Street and Pitt Street at Pitt Street Mall
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Boxing Day Sales road closure and special event clearways map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Boxing Day Sales road closure and special event clearways map

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and parking restrictions will be in place around Pitt St Mall for the safety of pedestrians during the Boxing Day Sales.

Road closures from 3am until 7pm

  • Market St between Elizabeth St and Pitt St. 
  • Castlereagh St between King St and Park St.

Road closures from 7am to 7pm 

  • Pitt St between Park St and Market St
  • Market St between Pitt St and George St

Two-way managed access will be available on Castlereagh St from King St and Park St only. No vehicle entry to Pitt St between Park and Market Streets after 7am, vehicles will be permitted to exit from Pitt St driveways southbound towards Park St under managed traffic control.

Special event clearways will be in effect on both sides of the Pitt, Market and Castlereagh Streets from 3am to 7pm. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, and apply even to local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways will be in effect on both sides of the roads below. Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

There will be no vehicle entry to driveways, loading docks or car parks on Pitt St between Park and Market Streets after 7am when the road is closed. Vehicles will be permitted to exit from driveways southbound onto Pitt St towards Park St under managed traffic control throughout the day.

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures, clearways and restricted access arrangements will be in place as large crowds are expected to attend New Year’s Eve celebrations in Dover Heights.

Roads around Dudley Page Reserve will close between 6pm and 2am including sections of Portland St, Gilbert St, Blake St, Hunter St, Victory St, and other local roads.

Access for residents will be maintained by NSW Police and Traffic Controllers on-site when safe to do so. Delays are expected as crowds leave the area after the 9pm and midnight fireworks. Residents are advised to avoid trying to enter/exit their properties during these times.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 4pm NYE to 2am NYD on sections of Blake St, Lancaster Rd, Military Rd and Portland St, and from 4pm until 7:30pm NYE on sections of Portland St. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

Motorists are reminded that access into various Eastern Suburb peninsulas will be restricted to local residents only from 3pm. In some areas, access is restricted to all vehicle traffic including residents after such time.

properties.headline: Fish Markets Christmas Trading  - Thursday 23 and Friday 24 December - PYRMONT Pyrmont Bridge Road and Bridge Road approaching Sydney Fish Markets
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Sydney Fish Market will operate to extended trading hours for the Christmas period from 5am Thursday 23 December until 5pm on Christmas Eve Friday 24 December.

Delays are expected on the Western Distributor approaching the Pyrmont and Glebe off-ramps as well as on local roads in the area. Motorists are advised to allow plenty of extra travel time as parking will be in very high demand.

Parking is available at Sydney Fish Market car park and also nearby at Sydney Secondary College on Pyrmont Bridge Rd.

Pedestrian access to the markets will be via the corner of Bank St and Pyrmont Bridge Rd, Pyrmont Bridge Rd near Wattle St and opposite the Fish Market Light Rail stop on Bank St.
properties.displayName: Fish Markets Christmas Trading  - Thursday 23 and Friday 24 December

roads.mainStreet: Pyrmont Bridge Road and Bridge Road

properties.headline: NYE in Watsons Bay - Friday 31 December - WATSONS BAY Old South Head Road at New South Head Road
properties.publicTransport: Buses will divert during road closures. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip or check for service changes.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: NYE road closure and special event clearways map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: NYE road closure and special event clearways map

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures, clearways and restricted access arrangements will be in place as large crowds are expected to attend New Year’s Eve celebrations (NYE) in Watsons Bay.

Sections of Marine Pde and Robertson Pl may close from 3pm NYE. Roads reopen from 2am New Year's Day (NYD) or once crowds have cleared however motorists should expect heavy traffic leaving the area after the midnight fireworks and should travel later to avoid the peak traffic.

Special event clearways will be in place on sections of Old South Head Rd and Military Rd from 2pm NYE until 2am NYD. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

Motorists are reminded that access into various Eastern Suburb peninsulas will be restricted to local residents only from 3pm. In some areas, access is restricted to all vehicle traffic including residents after such time.

arrangementAttachments.linkName: NYE road closures and special event clearways map

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures, lane closures, clearways and restricted access arrangements will be place this New Year's Eve (NYE) in Hunters Hill and Woolwich.

The Hunters Hill/Woolwich Peninsula will be closed at the Church St and Reiby Rd intersection from 11am NYE until 2am New Year's Day (NYD). After 11am, access will be maintained for residents and authorised passholders only. From 11:30pm NYE until 1:30am NYD the Burns Bay off-ramp to Church St will also close. 

Special event clearways will be in effect from 12pm midday NYE to 2am NYD on various roads including sections of The Avenue, Church St, Victoria Rd, Burns Bay Rd off-ramp, Alexandra St, Woolwich Rd and other local roads.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures, clearways and restricted access arrangements will be in place this New Year’s Eve (NYE) in Balmain, Rozelle, Birchgrove and Drummoyne in the Balmain Peninsula.

From 3pm roads into Balmain East & Birchgrove off Victoria Rd will close including sections of Darling St, Evans St, McKell St, Wharf Rd and other local roads. 

There will be no access for general traffic from Victoria Rd into the Balmain Peninsula after 3pm. Access will be maintained for residents on select roads with passes, buses, taxis (until 7pm) and other authorised vehicles only.

Roads will reopen from 12:30am on New Year's Day (NYD) or at the direction of NSW Police when safe to do so. Traffic may be heavy exiting the area so be patient or delay your travel.

Special event clearways will be in effect on Victoria Rd between The City West Link and Westbourne St (western side) from 3pm NYE until 2am NYD.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

properties.otherAdvice:
BBL: Sydney Sixers v Adelaide Strikers at the SCG. Start from 7.15pm, finish around 10.20pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park as fans travel to the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 5.15pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Access EP3 grass car park on Driver Ave or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd. Motorists travelling south on the Eastern Distributor should use the Randwick exit. EP2 Kippax grass car park near Moore Park Rd will not open for this event. 

Special event clearways will be in effect from 3pm to 11pm on sections of Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

properties.headline: Christmas Market - Friday 17 to Monday 20 December - CIRCULAR QUAY AND THE ROCKS Alfred St, George St, Argyle St
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip on public transport.
properties.adviceB: Allow extra travel time; Use public transport
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the Bastille French Christmas Market with events running from daily from 10am from Friday 17 - Monday 20 December.

The festival will be held at various locations around Circular Quay including Customs House on Alfred St, First Fleet Park off George St, outside the Museum of Contemporary Art, the Overseas Passenger Terminal in Circular Quay West and Argyle St in The Rocks.

No road closures will be in place for the event but motorists should exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads in the area throughout the festival.

properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the Tumbarumba Christmas Carnival from 5pm until 9pm on Friday 17 December. 

To accommodate the event The Parade (Batlow Rd) will be closed between Albury St and Selwyn St from 3pm to 11:30pm. 

Motorists can detour around the closure via Lauder St, Mate St and Albury St. Heavy vehicles can detour around the closures using the Rosewood to Greenhills access roads via Broadleaf Park Rd and Wondalga Rd. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on-site.

Road closures will be in place to support the event at the following locations: 

  • Wharf Rd between Watt St and Argyle St, and Merewether St from Wharf Rd to Worskshop Way from 5am NYE to 1am New Year's Day (NYD). Traffic will be diverted via Merewether St and Watt St.
  • Wharf Rd eastbound lanes from Merewether St roundabout to Argyle St from 5am NYE to 1am NYD.
  • Scott St/Hunter St eastbound lanes from Darby St to Watt St from 4pm to 9:30pm on NYE. Traffic will be diverted via Darby St.
  • Boat Harbour and Queens Wharf East/West car parks will be closed from 5am 30 December until 4pm 2 January.

Traffic may be heavier than normal along the Pacific Hwy, Hannell St and King St on approach to Newcastle East.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control on site and be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Cahill Expressway closure & clearways map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Cahill Expressway closure & clearways map

properties.otherAdvice:
The Cahill Expressway northbound lanes from the Domain Tunnel to the Sydney Harbour Bridge will be closed from 10pm Thursday 30 December 2021 to 4am Friday 7 January 2022 for Sydney New Year’s Eve and ELEVATE Sydney on the Circular Quay Overpass.

Northbound lanes will also close overnight on Tuesday 28 December between 10pm and 5am to allow for event set up.

Lane 4 on the Sydney Harbour Bridge will close each night from 9.30pm to 10.30pm from 1 - 5 January while the ELEVATE Sydney Sky Show takes place.

Southbound lanes of the Cahill Expressway will also be closed between 9pm 26 December and 4.30am 10 January for roadwork.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on the Sydney Harbour Bridge and Harbour Tunnel during the closure period so allow extra travel time.
properties.diversions: Sydney Harbour Tunnel or Sydney CBD via Macquarie St, Bridge St and Grosvenor St to rejoin the Sydney Harbour Bridge.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Carols in the Domain, gates open from 1pm and the event finishes 11pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Macquarie St, College St, William St and Art Gallery Rd approaching the Domain as crowds travel to the event so allow extra travel time. If you are planning on driving, arrive early as parking will be in high demand.

Art Gallery Rd will be closed to inbound traffic from 8pm to 11.30pm. Vehicles will be able to exit when safe to do so until the event finishes.

NSW Police may close roads outside The Domain from 9.30pm to allow crowds to safely leave the area after the event including:

  • Macquarie St between Hunter St and St James Rd.
  • St James Rd between Elizabeth St and Macquarie St
  • Princes Albert Rd between Macquarie St and Hospital Rd
  • St Marys Rd between Princes Albert Rd and Sir John Young Crescent
  • College St between Princes Albert Rd and William St

properties.otherAdvice:
With road closures and parking restrictions in place this New Year’s Eve ticketholders and attendees are encouraged to leave the car at home and catch public transport instead.

Some roads start closing from as early as midday with roads in Circular Quay, The Rocks and Pyrmont closed by 7pm, followed by the Sydney Harbour Bridge from 11pm ahead of the midnight fireworks. Most roads in the Sydney CBD remain closed until 4am on New Year's Day.

Key road closure timings:

  • 5am: roads in the Royal Botanic Garden & Domain including Art Gallery Rd
  • 12pm: Hickson Rd from Millers Point to Barangaroo.
  • 2pm: George St/Hickson Rd through The Rocks, Macquarie St north of Bridge St at Circular Quay, Wheat Rd Darling Harbour and Upper Fort St at Observatory Hill.
  • 5pm: roads north of Bridge St at Circular Quay including sections of Young, Pitt, Loftus and Macquarie Streets, and roads around Hyde Park/the Domain including Hospital Rd, College St, Prince Albert Rd
  • 7pm: Bridge St/Grosvenor St in the Sydney CBD, and roads in The Rocks, Millers Point and sections of Pirrama Rd in Pyrmont
  • 8.30pm to 9.30pm + 11pm to 1.30am: citybound lanes on the Anzac Bridge and Western Distributor
  • 10pm: roads around Wynyard including sections of York, Clarence and Margaret Streets
  • 11pm to 1.30am: Sydney Harbour Bridge closed in both directions and roads in Millers Point closed.
  • 4am: most roads in the Sydney CBD and Pyrmont reopened.
  • 6am: Macquarie St north of Bridge St reopens.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect on various roads in the City's North from 12pm on NYE until 4am on NYD. South of Circular Quay between Bridge St and Goulburn St will be in effect from 3pm on NYE until 4am on NYD. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in special event clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to speak to an operator and find its new location.

With road closures and parking restrictions in place this New Year’s Eve ticketholders and attendees are encouraged to leave the car at home and catch public transport instead.

Some roads in the city start closing from as early as midday with roads in Circular Quay, The Rocks and Pyrmont closed by 7pm, followed by the Sydney Harbour Bridge from 11pm ahead of the midnight fireworks. Most roads in the Sydney CBD remain closed until 4am on New Year's Day.

Key closure times in Pyrmont/Ultimo

  • 7pm to 4am: sections of Pirrama Rd and Harris St closed
  • 6pm to 1am: sections of Darling Island Rd, Fyfe St and Trouton Place closed

Sections of Kurraba Rd and Wallaringa Ave from Wycombe St, and Shellcove Rd from Harriette St will close from 5pm on NYE until 3am on NYD. 

Special event clearways will be in effect on nearby major roads including Falcon St and Military Rd from Neutral Bay to Mosman between 3pm and 3am.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.
